intro: Popowia schweinfurthii, commonly known as the African snowball, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a shrub that typically grows to a height of about 1 to 2 meters, featuring dense clusters of white, fluffy flowers that resemble snowballs. The plant has small, elliptical leaves that are arranged oppositely along the stems. It produces small, round fruits that contain several seeds, and it is often cultivated for its ornamental value. Popowia schweinfurthii thrives in well-drained soils and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth.
